intro: Diascia collina, commonly known as the mountain diascia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Diascia collina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its compact size and long blooming period.
